oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from Pvt. Mack Mitchell Bennett to his mother, Mary Angeline Edwards Bennett (regarding field artillery training)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pvt. Mack Mitchell Bennett (1892-1951) served in Btry. F, 318th F.A. Regt., 81st Div. during World War I. The letter, written on Camp Jackson letterhead, is addressed to his mother, Mary Angeline Edwards Bennett, in Huntingdon, Tennessee. He says he may not be able to return home before going overseas because of the high number of desertions. Pvt. Bennet also describes learning to handle what is most likely a "French 75" also know as a 75 mm Gun M1897.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
